      • connect

        public NetClient connect(int port,
                java.lang.String host,
                Handler<NetSocket> connectHandler)
        Description copied from interface: NetClient
        Attempt to open a connection to a server at the specific port and host. host can be a valid host name or IP addresss. The connect is done asynchronously and on success, a NetSocket instance is supplied via the connectHandler instance
        Specified by:
        connect in interface NetClient
        Returns:
        a reference to this so multiple method calls can be chained together

      • setReconnectAttempts

        public NetClient setReconnectAttempts(int attempts)
        Description copied from interface: NetClient
        Set the number of reconnection attempts. In the event a connection attempt fails, the client will attempt to connect a further number of times, before it fails. Default value is zero.
        Specified by:
        setReconnectAttempts in interface NetClient

      • setKeyStorePath

        public NetClient setKeyStorePath(java.lang.String path)
        Description copied from interface: NetClient
        Set the path to the SSL key store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after NetClient.setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        The SSL key store is a standard Java Key Store, and will contain the client certificate. Client certificates are only required if the server requests client authentication.

        Specified by:
        setKeyStorePath in interface NetClient
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • setKeyStorePassword

        public NetClient setKeyStorePassword(java.lang.String pwd)
        Description copied from interface: NetClient
        Set the password for the SSL key store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after NetClient.setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        Specified by:
        setKeyStorePassword in interface NetClient
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • setTrustStorePath

        public NetClient setTrustStorePath(java.lang.String path)
        Description copied from interface: NetClient
        Set the path to the SSL trust store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after NetClient.setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        The trust store is a standard Java Key Store, and should contain the certificates of any servers that the client trusts. If you wish the client to trust all server certificates you can use the NetClient.setTrustAll(boolean) method.

        Specified by:
        setTrustStorePath in interface NetClient
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • setTrustStorePassword

        public NetClient setTrustStorePassword(java.lang.String pwd)
        Description copied from interface: NetClient
        Set the password for the SSL trust store. This method should only be used in SSL mode, i.e. after NetClient.setSSL(boolean) has been set to true.

        Specified by:
        setTrustStorePassword in interface NetClient
        Returns:
        A reference to this, so multiple invocations can be chained together.

      • setTrustAll

        public NetClient setTrustAll(boolean trustAll)
        Description copied from interface: NetClient
        If you want an SSL client to trust *all* server certificates rather than match them against those in its trust store, you can set this to true.

        Use this with caution as you may be exposed to "main in the middle" attacks

        Specified by:
        setTrustAll in interface NetClient
        Parameters:
        trustAll - Set to true if you want to trust all server certificates
